main event: On the night of May 2, 1959, at 9:30 P.M., an observer reported seeing four bright lights in a winged formation moving in a northeasterly direction.
interesting points: The lights were observed for an extended period of time, approximately one hour and eight minutes., The lights changed color, transmitting red color at one point., The observer noted that the lights might have been stars if not for the cloud cover., The report mentions that the observation occurred in clear weather conditions., A lack of explanation for the lights led the observer to seek clarification.
sighted object: four bright lights moving in formation
witness description: The witness described seeing lights through a window and noted their unusual movement.
